history.content: This is a question about the data science major, not EECS or CS. Please post it on the DS 001 piazza.

children.subject:
Hi there, 

No problem at all, I totally understand the confusion. If you had questions about how to enroll in one of our courses, our advising team would definitely be the folks to ask. Unfortunately, your question seems to be about the declaration policies for the DS major, specifically "Can I declare with community college credit, even though I have already taken the course here?"

As the Data Science Division determines their own declaration requirements and reviews the applications to declare, they're really the only folks who can answer. My guess is that this is a really unique question and the answer isn't known yet. 

For our part, if you need help finding a CS 61B course at community college, you can use assist.org to select Cal, then the community college, then the computer science major to find the equivalent of any of our courses.
Thank you for such an insightful answer. I understand and appreciate your support!
Thank you for the response. I was told to post CS course enrollment policy related question here. I apologize for any inconvenience I have caused. Does the policy differ for the course then?

history.content: So I've put myself in a terrible situation... Long story short I came into Berkeley as an aspiring CS student but I had goofed around a lot and failed CS61B twice. Now I am trying to go for the new data science major I was wondering if it is possible to take an equivalent class at CC (given it has already been approved on assist.org) and use that to declare instead of CS61B? I understand that the CC course would not factor into the GPA but I just wanted to know if this is acceptable. Thanks!
history.subject: CC class to replace
